page.title: 14Transport in Yewdale
page.content: One{bus}per day goes from Coniston along the A593 via{Skelwith Bridge}to {Ambleside.}The only other service provided is for children attending the primary and secondary schools in {Coniston,}who are taken to school in two{minibuses}operated by the local garage. Transport for those without vehicles can also be provided by a voluntary service centred on Coniston. In this area, the{motor vehicle}reigns supreme (especially if it has four wheel drive !) People in the area had the facility of{rail}transport from Coniston until the closure of the line in 1958. The closure is increasingly regarded as a grave error, not least because the railway would have developed as an important tourist attraction as well as a means of diverting traffic from crowded roads in summer.
